args:
Mercury succeeded in defending Saint Lotier, but
at terrible personal cost. Though not fatal, the
damage she suffered would require an extended
period of convalescence by the sea to recover.
How lovely the glittering tides are.\nI'm tempted to slip back into my old\nform and go for a nice, long dive.
But... I'll resist for now. I'm under doctor's\norders to stay in human form to speed my\nrecovery along.
I can't very well ignore Simurgh's advice\nafter she came all this way to treat me.
Indeed. Rest yourself, Waterwyrm.\nThat is your duty now.
I heard of what transpired in Saint Lotier.\nHave you no sense at all? Surely you knew\nwhat would befall you by acting so rashly.
I am aware of your fondness for the city.\nEven so, I cannot endorse any behavior\nthat would cause our master grief.
Windwyrm... It is as you say.\nI make no excuses for my selfishly\nunleashing that power.
As long as you understand. Still,\nwhat moved you to such lengths?
Depending on your answer, I may\nneed to deliver quite the lecture.\nWell?
Now wait just a gosh darned minute!\nWhat are you thinking, barking at her\nlike that while she's still on the mend?
Less yelling, more get-well-ing.\nHere, Mercury, this is for you!
Goodness, even Siren is here!\nWhat's all this you've brought?
A whole bunch of get-well-soon gifts! ☆\nEveryone back at the Halidom sent me\noff with them to help cheer you up.
There's so much here. Flowers,\nletters, an embroidered handkerchief...\nAnd is this a new line of cosmetics?
Could these all be from the people\nI started getting to know recently?
Ding ding ding! They're all worried sick\nfor their new bestie.
To think you would adopt human form and\ngrow close enough to be called a friend...\nIs this related to your present plight, then?
Yes. As I mingled among them, they\ntaught me to see mankind not as a race,\nbut as individuals, each of them unique.
Though they may be frail of body, I learned\nthat man is a courageous animal, every bit\ncapable of standing up to stronger foes.

That we dragons needn't foist our
one-sided protection upon them.
I felt like...a mother watching her
chicks fly from the nest.
But even so, I could not stop myself from\nacting to aid them. To keep them safe.
I see. And so, caught in that contradiction,\nyour urge to protect them took precedence\nover all else, and this was the result.
Yes. Exactly that.\n...Tell me something, Windwyrm.
Am I wrong as a mighty dragon to harbor\nprotectiveness for these fragile humans?
SUPER sorry to interrupt what sounds like\na serious conversation, but we've got a\nproblem!
The fishies just told me the imperial\nforces are back at it, in the city!
They've returned to Saint Lotier?!\nNo... I must go.
Waterwyrm, wait! You've not yet healed.
You think she's gonna listen? Her home's\nunder attack! We've gotta go after her,\nMidgardsormr!
Go! March on Saint Lotier and show these\nfools what becomes of any who defy the\nEmpire!
Not once, but twice you insist on this\nfoolishness. You will rue this day. Face\njudgment at the hands of my true form!
The dragons are here! Concentrate\nyour fire, men! Pin them down!
I shall lend a hand. Hrah!
And I will finish this! Water, heed—ngah?!
Ngh... I just moved too quickly.\nI seem to have reopened my wound...
Look there! The guardian dragon's still\nweak from before!
Ignore the other beasts! All units, fire\non the water dragon! Finish her off!
No! Waterwyrm, fall back behind us!
Good. Those two can't fight back\nwhile carrying that much dead weight.\nConvene on them now! All units, forward!
No, they're coming this way! We need to—\nHnngh! Argh...!
(My body won't listen! I'm trying to move,\nbut something cold and frightful grips my\nheart. Is this...fear?)
Do humans all march into battle with this\nsensation in their breast? It's crushing...
Yet those men stood before me as my\nshield that day. Their courage is nothing\nshort of heroic.
Brave humans, you are anything but weak.\nHow could I overlook such strength all this\ntime?
My lord! Why are you here?!
Midgardsormr informed me of what was\nhappening here. Come, we'll drive them\nback together.
Have no fear. You're not alone.\nLook at all the people who've come\nrunning to assist you!
Guardian dragon! This time,\nallow us to fight by your side!
Brave heroes... Yes. I understand. Let us\ndefend our city together—man and dragon,\nhand in hand!
Whew, that's the last of 'em cleaned up!\nI tried to make it hurt JUST enough to\nmake them think twice about coming back.
I question their capacity to learn, but at the\nvery least they now know they cannot hope\nto take the city easily.
Not now that they've seen the strength of a\ncity defended by...＂man and dragon, hand\nin hand,＂ was it?
Indeed. I feel I've only just now come to\nunderstand what it really means to coexist.
To acknowledge each other's strengths and\nweaknesses both, to bolster the former and\ncomplement the latter. As we did today.
Before the battle, you posed me a query.\nYou asked whether it was wrong to feel\nprotective of humans, as a mightier being.
I suspect you've already surmised my\nanswer, but I will tender it just the same:\nabsolutely not.
It is simple fact that dragons are stronger\nthan men. That the strong ought to protect\nthe weak is a part of the natural order.
But the wounds you bear are the result of\na different emotion. You wished to defend\nthem not as a dragon, but as an individual.
I...suppose you're right. For that,\nI am truly—
And that is not a mistake, either. Whatever\nyour emotions at the time, you sought to\nkeep the people of this city safe.
—sorry...? Er. Wait.\nYou would not condemn me?
The people of Saint Lotier love you, their\nguardian dragon. I think that is answer\nenough to all your questions.
Agreed! Dragon's duty or personal feelings,\nthey're both the same warm desire to keep\nyour peeps safe. They're both right!
Ooh, but I still think you're really amazing\nfor asking the tough questions about your\nown motivations, though! Mad respect!
I truly do! Most dragons would never even\nthink of that stuff, honestly. I never have,\nat least!
Having that doubt is proof you're thinking\nabout humans from their own perspective\nafter really getting to know them.
Because I finally cast away my\npreconceptions and decided to\nactually learn about them, you mean?
Ha ha... Then perhaps I really have\ngrown somewhat from this experience.
A noble pursuit. And a fine result,\nwhat's more.
I have the people of the Halidom,\nwho opened their hearts and lives\nto me, to thank for it all.
Now, I need to recover as quickly as I'm\nable...so that I can go and thank them\nproperly in person.
